discourse_list.title: Calling All Lawyers! Would You Like To Help Contribute?

content.content: Hello all ! We would like to get a running list of the attorneys in this space and their areas of expertise, as well as their relevant jurisdictions.  I can go first. I am an attorney in the U.S. (New York)- my areas of practice currently include civil litigation stemming from liability, risk management and I advise some client’s in the web3 space as to best practices. I have become well versed in other areas of the law as I have delved into crypto and defi, such as some regulatory issues that arise in the states. I have also studied government and worked for the government.
Have you considered becoming a delegate @MFeinberg
I do not really know all that is involved with that but I am certainly open to it. I have time constraints with my work but if I can help out in that role I would absolutely consider it.
I’d be happy to have a chat if you’re interested.
Yea, sure, let’s do it!
MFeinberg:  I can help out in that role I would absolutely consider it.   Now you’re talking!! LFG
I need to work on my platform this weekend
8 posts were split to a new topic: [Discussion] Delegate Roles and Incentives
Much more interesting than other billable work, I’m sure
Sometimes it’s hard to control how much fun it is

Hi Matt! I´m a lawyer and IP agent, specializing in Intellectual Property with experience in advising entrepreneurship, companies and businesses. DeFi & Crypto enthusiast, user of different blockchains and protocols. I live in Buenos Aires, Argentina. You can count on me for any collaboration in my area of ​​expertise.
Wonderful! Thanks for commenting on this thread! let’s go!
Wondering: do you have cases in web3 beyond DeFi?
I have clients in web3 outside of defi but I would really love to gather a roster of community members that are lawyers. There are so many areas of the law that are relevant in this space.

Loop me in. Have been involved with Maker at some level for years now, including an engagement with a core unit when I was at a firm. Currently in-house. Corporate with a focus on startups/VC and crypto, with experience also in M&A and some cap markets. California and D.C.

Great! The idea is to start to keep a list of attorney community members. This could serve various purposes, including referrals and so we can get informed feedback from the community. While we may not be giving legal advice per se, we can talk about the issue and flesh out some stuff.

Hi, I am an attorney in Argentina (Buenos Aires) and my area of practice include intellectual property. I also advise companies and entrepreneurs in commercial areas. I’ve been in crypto and DeFi for a few years now and I’m applying my legal knowledge to advice web3 developers. It would be a pleasure to collaborate with anything here at Maker.
GREAT! Thanks so much for the info. We have so much talent in the community that we can use to scale.

Hey there! I am a lawyer based out of Europe. I started my career at a large global firm, was general counsel at a publicly listed multinational company and started my own business about 7 years ago. Before getting involved in crypto/web3, I gained ample experience in renewable energy, real estate and corporate & commercial law in a broad sense. That background also led to a small role as Mkr rep in the 6S financing structure. Happy to contribute so let’s chat.

Great! Thank you so much for this response! Thank you for joining this thread! We are hoping to have a list of all of our community members that hold some type of legal degree. We all have our little areas where we can add significant value, for informational purposes and brainstorming.

Croker Huck Law Firm    David J. Skalka | Croker Huck Law Firm | Omaha, Nebraska Good for business — call Omaha business and corporate law attorneys Croker Huck Law Firm at 402-391-6777.      I have been involved with Maker for about 14 months. The skills that are helpful here are my creditor rights and contract and real estate practice and then my personal interest for many years in computing and crypto.
Great! Thanks for this post! We are slowly compiling a great list of community members with legal experience. Onward and upward !
Hi! I’m a lawyer from Venezuela. I’m interested in collaborated with this, because is a topic I liked, and I write about web 3 in a DAO blog.
Wonderful! Welcome! Do you have a link to the dao blog ?
Hey, @MFeinberg, just checking in to see if you were able to find the contribution needed. If not, I can help spread more awareness on this topic through the govcomm publications. Let me know!

Thanks! The goal really is to get a running list of community members that happen to be attorneys and work in the space. The way I figure it that will help:  The community informally discuss developing legal issues by using the communities experiences; and People to be able to find counsel should they need it (attorney to attorney and/or client to attorney) in jurisdictions all over the world.  So far, thankfully, we have some people expressed their willingness to partake but we could use more. And at some point maybe we can do a directory somewhere and make it clear that Maker is not endorsing any of these people or vouching for licenses. At the end of the day it’s DYOR but at least we can have this for informative purposes.

Hi, I’m a regulatory specialist, not a lawyer! Maybe close enough, quite a bit of structured finance experience, credit risk, bank capital and liquidity, other compliancy stuff. Been doing a bit of reading and lurking here recently, happy to help with anything.
Great! Thank you for the post! We have such a talented community here. You have more relevant experience than many attorneys!
Hey @jessiway can you share the link to the DAO blog? I would love to read it.

PA attorney here with about 6 years in the structured finance/capital markets space.  I primarily work on deals that use Delaware statutory trusts or NY common law trusts. Primarily deal with NY/DE governed docs. Currently in BigLaw.
NICE! Welcome! I know we have some CUs and community members that are utilizing DE statutory trusts. @christiancdpetersen being one. Thanks so much for the info, this is fantastic.
Please DM me if you want to hear more of what we are doing. I am always in need of contributors and assistance!

Hello everybody! I’m José, from Argentina. I am a law student, about to graduate (in December this year). Regarding my experience in legal matters that may be relevant in this forum, I was a legislative advisor, mainly elaborating and reviewing draft bills. Regarding Web3, I am particularly interested in the elaboration of legal frameworks that allow and encourage its development. Excited to read you and to be here.

Wonderful! We keep adding to this thread so people can always come take a look to see if anyone can help them navigate this space. And, of course, find people who are looking to hire recent graduates (congrats in advance)!

Hi everyone! I am a recent Masters graduate from Stanford Law School. Prior to this, I worked with top corporate law firms in India for 6 years and advised international clients on tax-efficient corporate structuring, cross-border transactions and regulatory investigations. At Stanford, I focused on corporate and emerging companies practice areas in the US, including Delaware Corporate Law, Venture Capital, International Business Transactions and Corporate Finance. Interested in regulatory issues around DeFi and DAOs.
Welcome! Congrats on the recent graduation as well!  There are more regulatory issues coming (at least in the US) as that “crypto bill” makes its way through committees.

Hello! I am an attorney based in Palo Alto at a global law firm.  During law school, I ran a small crypto miner on a Geforce GTX 280, keeping all my coins safe in MtGox. Then, for about nine years, I worked in IP litigation while assisting others across the firm with a variety of blockchain related issues.  I recently transferred to investment management focused on SEC/Regulatory concerns so that I could focus on digital assets more.  Of course, my firm frowns on moonlighting on non-firm-client legal work, but I’m happy to provide a non-legal review on anything.
Welcome! Thank you for the post! The Maker community has so much talent and it keeps growing.
We have a strong legal department in regulation and compliance and web3.0 at Oasis Pro.  Those individuals will be jumping in here with backgrounds shortly.
Great! We have a nice long thread here of talented community members!

Good Day.Lawyer based out of Europe but keep crazy hours.Started and continue my career at large global law firms and longterm MakerDao holder and lurker more recently.Focus with securities regulations UK EU US which now includes crypto/web3.Slowly becoming more involved.No interest in becoming a delegate.noway

Welcome to the thread! Thank you so much for the post. Our list of talented community members is so large and that was the reason why I wanted to put a thread on the forum.  We can look within to discuss developing issues on the horizon.

GM everyone! I’m the chief legal officer at Infinite Capital, a crypto and deep tech investment firm that’s been around since 2017 with investments across DeFi, Web3, and related infrastructure. Prior to aping into crypto, I ran North American sponsorship/endorsement deals at Miller Coors and before then was the General Counsel at Jockey, the underwear company. Would love to be involved with something like this and absolutely need references on outside counsel. Please keep me posted on plans to bring this together and how I can help!
NimitaParekh:  Prior to aping into crypto,   I love this quote! Thank you so much for posting on this thread. Welcome to the community as well!
Thank you! It’s been a wild ride but I’m here for it! Looking forward to collaborating on the legal side
Hey! Sorry for not answered. This is the blog  Lo NFTs y su impacto en el arte y la tecnología | Medium
